title: Data Analysis: Sampling Distribution
question_text:
Suppose a sample of size $ n = 8$ is taken of high school students’ ACT scores.
If the population mean is $23$ with a standard deviation of $2.4$, determine the sampling distribution of samples like this of size $n = 8$.

choices.text:
Mean = $23$
Standard deviation = $2.4$
Shape is approximately normal.

Mean = $23$
Standard deviation = $0.8485$
Shape is unable to be determined.

Mean = $23$
Standard deviation = $2.4$
Shape is unable to be determined.

Mean = 184
Standard deviation = 2.4
Shape is approximately normal.

Mean = 2.875
Standard deviation = 2.4
Shape is approximately normal.

solution:
When asked to determine the sampling distribution, shape, center, and spread are the main features that should be mentioned.

For shape, when samples are large (greater than 30
), the sampling distribution will be approximately normal. However, when samples are small, such as this one, the shape will be unknown but non-normal.

The mean of the sampling distribution will be equal to the population mean, 23
